FILE NAME:     RSMELS
DATE MODIFIED: November 1, 2023
USED BY:       RSMELSREAD subroutine of the National Energy Modeling System (NEMS) Residential Demand Module (RDM)
DEFINITION:    Miscellaneous electric loads (MELs) stock and unit energy consumption (UEC) indices
UNITS:         Index (2020=1.0000)
DIMENSION:     MEL technology, projection year
SPECIAL CONSTRAINTS: non-negative values
ORGANIZATION OF DATA: The columns are years 2016-2050, while the rows are in order of the end uses listed at the bottom.
               First five uses are TV-related, next four are PC-related, then the rest are reported as among "electric other."
               Data starts on row 21 of this file per RDM convention
SOURCES:       2015 Residential Energy Consumption Survey (RECS): https://www.eia.gov/consumption/residential/
               "Analysis and Representation of Miscellaneous Electric Loads in NEMS," https://www.eia.gov/analysis/studies/demand/miscelectric/
               "Residential Miscellaneous Electric Loads: Energy Consumption Characterization and Savings Potential," TIAX, 2007
               Various DOE rulemakings Technical Support Documents and ENERGY STAR product specifications
COMMENT:       Updated stock & UECs for latest energy star and fed standards; Re-indexed to 2020=1 for new RECS base year

13	Dehumidifiers	DEH
14	Microwaves	MCO
